channel.title: Principled Societies Project
channel.description: Empowering Individuals, Organizations, and Communities Solve Problems That Matter

item.title: Is Solving Problems the Ideal of Democracy and Capitalism?
item.description: Societies can solve important problems. Doing so is the essence of sustainability. But systems innovation is necessary.

item.title: Solving Problems That Matter Could Be the Next Big Thing
item.description: By viewing a society as a problem-solving superorganism, the natural sciences and technology sector can go wild with possibilities. Designs of economic, governance, and legal systems fall into their domain.

item.title: An Economy of Meaning, or Bust
item.description: Current economic systems are dismal because they waste our precious time. We can pause to reevaluate, and redesign.

item.title: Wellbeing Centrality: Toward an Economics and Politics of Meaning
item.description: The designs of current economic and governance systems may be inadequate to solve our many pressing problems. Ideas from complex systems science and other fields can help us re-conceptualize systems, leading to better designs.

item.title: Why Stop at Basic Income and a Living Wage?
item.description: We can ask the big question: Out of all conceivable economic system designs, which ones might be best at helping us to focus on and solve problems that matter?
